abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Water Sector
            Consolidation Project is to support the achievement of
            sustainable universal access to safe and affordable water
            for the population of Guyana, especially the poor. The
            extension is being requested to enable the completion of the
            main works under the project and to measure after completion
            the resulting improvements of the level of service.
            Principally the construction of three water treatment
            plants, which has experienced delays due to a combination of
            factors, namely initial delays in arranging the required
            subcontracting and liquidity issues from the main
            contractor, needs to be completed. Construction is now
            around 70 percent complete and is forecasted to be completed
            by September 2010 at the present rate of implementation
            progress. Project implementation was delayed by the
            termination of a contract for well drilling and another for
            transmission main setup. The new contract for well drilling
            to complete the remaining works is currently being
            negotiated for signature and is expected to be completed in
            four months. Six additional months following the completion
            of the works will be necessary to measure the improvements
            of the level of service in the project areas and evaluate
            the overall project achievement. The change is the extension
            of the closing date of the project by 12 months from its
            current closing date of March 31st, 2010, to March 31, 2011.
